meanings.definition: Producing or capable of producing electricity.
meanings.sent1: The electric eel is known for its electrogenic abilities.
meanings.sent2: Solar panels are an electrogenic source of power for homes.
meanings.sent3: The lightning storm turned the sky into an electrogenic light show.
meanings.sent4: The electrogenic energy in the air was palpable before the storm.
meanings.sent5: The electrogenic power plant hummed with energy day and night.

meanings.definition: Relating to the generation of electricity.
meanings.sent1: The electrogenic technology revolutionized the energy industry.
meanings.sent2: The electrogenic engineer designed a new power grid system.
meanings.sent3: The electrogenic dance floor lit up with every step.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were as electrifying as an electrogenic storm.
meanings.sent5: The electrogenic city buzzed with innovation and power.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to generate an electric charge.
meanings.sent1: Certain fish have electrogenic organs for defense.
meanings.sent2: The electrogenic material sparked interest in the scientific community.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur seemed to have an electrogenic effect when petted.
meanings.sent4: The atmosphere was charged with an electrogenic tension.
meanings.sent5: The electrogenic device emitted a faint, steady glow.
